TEXT: The applicant , born in DATE , is a citizen of former GPE residing in GPE ( GPE ) . He is the general manager and a shareholder of a building company . Before the ORG he is represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE ( GPE ) .

In DATE the applicant arrived in GPE . In DATE and DATE he travelled for short periods to GPE . In DATE he married PERSON , a NORP citizen . He is the father of CARDINAL children , born in DATE and DATE .

On DATE the applicant was arrested and subsequently taken into detention with a view to extradition ( Auslieferungshaft ) . The applicant ’s arrest was based on an international arrest warrant of CARDINAL DATE issued by a court in GPE , GPE ( GPE ) . The applicant was suspected of having raped a woman in DATE in GPE .
On DATE ORG in GPE submitted to the NORP judicial authorities a request for the applicant ’s extradition to GPE .

On DATE ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) ordered the applicant ’s continued detention with a view to extradition . Subsequently , the court ordered the applicant ’s extradition to GPE and found that there were no obstacles to it . The prosecution of the applicant had not yet become time - barred and concerned an extraditable offence . Furthermore , the applicant was not a NORP citizen . The applicant had denied having committed the offence he was charged with . However , whether or not the accusation was well - founded was not an issue to be addressed in the extradition proceedings , and there was no indication that the request for extradition had been made arbitrarily . Regarding the necessity of the applicant ’s detention with a view to extradition , the court noted that the risk of the applicant ’s absconding existed . In case of a conviction he risked a severe sentence . Furthermore , when he had been arrested in GPE in the context of the criminal proceedings against him in DATE , he had been released on bail and had absconded .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for having his extradition declared unlawful and rejected the request for release from detention with a view to extradition . ORG found that since its decision of CARDINAL DATE the applicant ’s situation had not changed . Neither the fact that the applicant had been recognised as refugee by the NORP authorities nor the fact that he was married to a NORP citizen made him a NORP citizen within the meaning of LAW ) . Therefore he could not rely on the prohibition to extradite NORP citizens provided for in LAW .

On DATE the applicant applied to ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) . He submitted that the prohibition to extradite NORP citizens should also apply to him because , although not being a NORP citizen , he had close personal and family links to GPE
On DATE ORG declined to accept the appeal for adjudication on the ground that it did not have a sufficient prospect of success .
